titles.title: Condemning the atrocities that occurred in 1811, in Louisiana, in which enslaved people revolted for freedom and were brutalized, terrorized, and killed in response, and reaffirming the commitment of the House of Representatives in combating hatred, injustice, and White supremacy.

Condemning the atrocities that occurred in 1811, in Louisiana, in which enslaved people revolted for freedom and were brutalized, terrorized, and killed in response, and reaffirming the commitment of the House of Representatives in combating hatred, injustice, and White supremacy.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: This resolution expresses support for the designation of a national day of remembrance for the victims of forced migration of Black people throughout United States history.
